intro: Leionema nudum, commonly known as the smooth leionema, is a low-growing shrub native to New Zealand. It belongs to the family Proteaceae and is characterized by its dense, compact foliage and small, showy flowers. The plant has narrow, leathery leaves that are typically arranged in a spiral pattern along the stems. It produces white or pale pink flowers that bloom in clusters, often attracting native pollinators. Leionema nudum is well adapted to coastal environments and is often found in rocky or sandy soils.
